channel.title: XP changing
channel.description:
I know this is a stupid question but where do i change my fletching's xp rates?
All i can tell that its not in client.java , i checked all over the place..
Any suggestions?
I'm using PK PLANET base.

item.title: XP changing
item.dc:creator: @Dastan1 Dastan_
item.description:
@Dastan1 wrote:

lets just forget about it. :rolleyes:

Anyways… does anyone know how to help me?

Read full topic

item.title: XP changing
item.dc:creator: @bily123 bily123
item.description:
@bily123 wrote:

[quote=“Dastan_, post:19, topic:353070”]dude i’m not an idiot nor first grader. I’m not a noob to whom you have to explain how to change simple stat xp !!! you should’ve red all of the replys before posting yours… =/

but thx for trying. I appreciate it.[/quote]
i did read them none of them mentioned this area in client.java and i didn’t call you a moron or anything so you don’t have to act all defensive. People explain things like this so it’s easy to understand. It’s not aimed at calling you stupid it’s just a natural thing to do.

item.title: XP changing
item.dc:creator: @bily123 bily123
item.description:
@bily123 wrote:

I found this in client.java

[code]if (itemUsed == 233 && useWith == 237) {
deleteItem(237, getItemSlot(237), 1);
addItem(235, 1);
} else if (itemUsed == 946 && useWith == 1511) {
if (playerLevel[9] >= 1) {
deleteItem(1511, getItemSlot(1511), 1);
addItem(48, 1);
addSkillXP((40 * playerLevel[9]), 9);
} else {
sM(
“You need a fletching level of 1 to make this bow.”);
}
} else if (itemUsed == 946 && useWith == 1521) {
if (playerLevel[9] >= 20) {
deleteItem(1521, getItemSlot(1521), 1);
addItem(56, 1);
addSkillXP((60 * playerLevel[9]), 9);
} else {
sM(
“You need a fletching level of 20 to make this bow.”);
}
} else if (itemUsed == 946 && useWith == 1519) {
if (playerLevel[9] >= 40) {
deleteItem(1519, getItemSlot(1519), 1);
addItem(58, 1);
addSkillXP((80 * playerLevel[9]), 9);
} else {
sM(
“You need a fletching level of 40 to make this bow.”);
}
} else if (itemUsed == 946 && useWith == 1517) {
if (playerLevel[9] >= 50) {
deleteItem(1517, getItemSlot(1517), 1);
addItem(62, 1);
addSkillXP((100 * playerLevel[9]), 9);
} else {
sM(
“You need a fletching level of 50 to make this bow.”);
}
} else if (itemUsed == 946 && useWith == 1515) {
if (playerLevel[9] >= 60) {
deleteItem(1515, getItemSlot(1515), 1);
addItem(66, 1);
addSkillXP((120 * playerLevel[9]), 9);
} else {
sM(
“You need a fletching level of 60 to make this bow.”);
}
} else if (itemUsed == 946 && useWith == 1513) {
if (playerLevel[9] >= 80) {
deleteItem(1513, getItemSlot(1513), 1);
addItem(70, 1);
addSkillXP((140 * playerLevel[9]), 9);
} else {
sM(
“You need a fletching level of 80 to make this bow.”);
}

    } // ------------------------end of cutting--------------------------------[/code]

the addskillxp number can be changed which will cause the exp rate to change.
example: addSkillXP((140 * playerLevel[9]), 9); if i change that 140 to a 150 then the exp rate will change. If my fletch level is 82 it works at 140x82.

Read full topic

item.title: XP changing
item.dc:creator: @Dastan1 Dastan_
item.description:
@Dastan1 wrote:

no , it’s not.

what i want to do is change exp of shortbows , longbows , arrows and so , so on. lets say i get 2k xp for making a oak shortbow , i want to change it to 200 , there is nothing like that in player.java

all i can find is : public int fletchId = -1, fletchAmount = -1, fletchLog = -1,
originalW = -1, originalS = -1, fletchExp = 0;

Read full topic

item.title: XP changing
item.dc:creator: @Jingojohn Jingojohn
item.description:
@Jingojohn wrote:

Go into characters, click yours, and change Skill ID 13. Change the number to 99. I forget but I think there is an XP number too. Change that to 99999999 That should to it.

Read full topic
